Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a drab-coloured pottery jar, the fabric is partially red in section and contains a large number of small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of the remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as meat of year 12.
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten III pl.91, no.180.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393478) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393478)
